testCases.explanation: Distance of [1,3] = sqrt(10). Distance of [-2,2] = sqrt(8). [-2,2] is closer.
Both points are equidistant (distance=1). Either is valid; [0,1] is accepted.
Only one point, it is the closest.

description:
Given an array of `points` where `points[i] = [xi, yi]` represents a point on the X-Y plane and an integer `k`, return the `k` closest points to the origin `(0, 0)`.

The distance between two points on the X-Y plane is the Euclidean distance: sqrt((x1 - x2)^2 + (y1 - y2)^2).

You may return the answer in any order. The answer is guaranteed to be unique (except for the order that it is in).

See the full problem on [LeetCode 973](https://leetcode.com/problems/k-closest-points-to-origin/).

examples.explanation: The distance between (1,3) and origin is sqrt(10). The distance between (-2,2) and origin is sqrt(8). Since sqrt(8) < sqrt(10), (-2,2) is closer.
